Beijing, People's Republic of China
People's Republic of China
Chairman: Mr. Zhang Xiwu
Coal production, transportation, Electricity generation
China Shenhua Energy Company

LayoutNode.Content: Shenhua Group (Chinese: {{{3}}}) is a state-owned mining and energy company in China. It is the largest coal-producing company in the world. It was founded in October 1995 under the auspices of the State Council of the People's Republic of China.
LayoutNode.SRC: Shenhua Group (Chinese: {{{3}}}) is a state-owned mining and energy company in China. It is the largest coal-producing company in the world. It was founded in October 1995 under the auspices of the State Council of the People's Republic of China.
• 3.1 Water pollution
• 5 External links

LayoutNode.Content: The Shenhua Group operates Shenfu Dongsheng coalfield as well as the affiliated railway assets, power plants, port facilities, shipping fleet, and coal liquefaction projects. In addition to the coal production in China, Shenhua is also looking at investments in Mongolia, Indonesia and Australia.
LayoutNode.SRC: The Shenhua Group operates Shenfu Dongsheng coalfield as well as the affiliated railway assets, power plants, port facilities, shipping fleet, and coal liquefaction projects. In addition to the coal production in China, Shenhua is also looking at investments in Mongolia, Indonesia and Australia.

LayoutNode.Content: The coal-to-liquid (CTL) plant, based in coal-rich Inner Mongolia, is expected to launch production in the third quarter of 2008. The firm constructed the first coal-to-olefin plant. On November 2, 2010 Dow Chemical Company announced plans to apply for permission to build the Yulin Integrated Project a joint venture with Shenhua to build an integrated complex of coal, power and chemicals in Yulin, Shaanxi.
LayoutNode.SRC: The coal-to-liquid (CTL) plant, based in coal-rich Inner Mongolia, is expected to launch production in the third quarter of 2008. The firm constructed the first coal-to-olefin plant. On November 2, 2010 Dow Chemical Company announced plans to apply for permission to build the Yulin Integrated Project a joint venture with Shenhua to build an integrated complex of coal, power and chemicals in Yulin, Shaanxi.

LayoutNode.Content: The company has more than 30 subsidiaries, including:

LayoutNode.Content: Its subsidiary China Shenhua Energy Company is listed at the Hong Kong Stock Exchange and Shanghai Stock Exchange.
LayoutNode.SRC: Its subsidiary China Shenhua Energy Company is listed at the Hong Kong Stock Exchange and Shanghai Stock Exchange.

LayoutNode.Content: Shenhua Group is China's largest coal miner. Environmental effects of coal are large.
LayoutNode.SRC: Shenhua Group is China's largest coal miner. Environmental effects of coal are large.

LayoutNode.Content: According to Greenpeace in July 2013 Shenhua Group has reduced groundwater levels in an Inner Mongolia region and discharged high levels of toxic wastewater.
LayoutNode.SRC: According to Greenpeace in July 2013 Shenhua Group has reduced groundwater levels in an Inner Mongolia region and discharged high levels of toxic wastewater.
